original: NYSTRÖM, John Emil Emanuel, Grosshandlare, Norrköping, f S:t Olai, östergötl l, 24/8 90 av spinnmäst F E N o Clara Andersson, gm Märta Forsberg. Hdlsutbildn. Kontorist i fma Werner Ericssons Pappersaff en gros i Norrkp (grund 00), senare resande i samma fma, övertog den 18 und namn Werner Ericssons Eftr John Nyström, Papper en gros. Styr.led i Sv Såp- & Tvålfabr AB i Norrkp 18. Styr.led i östergötl Fabr- o Grossistfrb o ordf 1 dess papperssektion, medlem i Sv Pappers-grosshandl.frns avd i Sthlm, i Sv Pappers-grossistfrb i Sthlm o i Hdlsfrn i Norrkp, medl av Norrkps Köpm.frn o led av dess gransk-ningsnmd f ackordsärenden. Led av tax.nmd. Rev i Bostadsfrn Rörläggaren i Norrkp. Frimurare, Odd Fellow (skattmäst i Log nr 19 Louis De Geer i Norrkp 34—41), styr.suppl i Sällsk VGB i Norrkp o dess rev 40. Resor: Norge 35, Tyskl 36, Danm 39. Hobbies: Det egna arbetet, resor.
translated: NYSTRÖM, John Emil Emanuel, Merchant, Norrköping, born in S:t Olai, Östergötland County, on August 24, 1890, son of master spinner F E N and Clara Andersson, married to Märta Forsberg. Commercial training. Office clerk at Werner Ericsson's Wholesale Paper Store in Norrköping (established in 1900), later became a traveling representative for the same company. Took over and changed the name to Werner Ericsson's Successor John Nyström, Wholesale Paper. Board member of the Swedish Soap and Soap Factory Ltd in Norrköping since 1918. Board member of the Östergötland Factory and Wholesale Association and chairman of its paper section. Member of the Swedish Paper Wholesale Association in Stockholm, the Swedish Paper Wholesale Association in Stockholm, and the Norrköping Trade Association. Member of the Norrköping Merchants' Association and a member of its review board for piecework matters. Member of the taxation committee. Auditor at the Housing Association Rörläggaren in Norrköping. Freemason, Odd Fellow (treasurer in Lodge No. 19 Louis De Geer in Norrköping from 1934 to 1941). Deputy board member of the Society VGB in Norrköping and auditor in 1940. Travels: Norway 1935, Germany 1936, Denmark 1939. Hobbies: His own work, traveling.
